summary.para: IXAudio2 is the interface for the XAudio2 object that manages all audio engine states, the audio processing thread, the voice graph, and so forth.

This is the only XAudio2 interface that is derived from the COM IUnknown interface. It controls the lifetime of the XAudio2 object using two methods derived from IUnknown: and . No other XAudio2 objects are reference-counted; their lifetimes are explicitly controlled using create and destroy calls, and are bounded by the lifetime of the XAudio2 object that owns them.

remarks.para: The DirectX SDK versions of XAUDIO2 included three member functions that are not present in the Windows 8 version: GetDeviceCount, GetDeviceDetails, and Initialize. These enumeration methods are no longer provided and standard Windows Audio APIs should be used for device enumeration instead.
